_description: John Audelay, ‘De visitacione infirmorum & consolacione miserorum’ — thirty-one 13-line stanzas

BodDou302.First Lines:
Saynt ancelyne þat hole bischopHe med þis tretys be godis
                    grace …
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…& howe ȝe schul amendis makeTo haue þat ioy
                    þat is euer lastyng
BodDou302.Attributed Title:
De visitacione infirmorum et consolacione miserorum (f.
                        12vb); Explicit visitacio infirmorum et consolacio
                        miserorum (at the end)
BodDou302.Editions:
Whiting,  Ella Keats,
                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 82-94.
Fein,  Susanna Greer,
                        ed.  
             John The Blind
                    Audelay, The Counsel of Conscience.
         Kalamazoo, Michigan: Medieval Institute Publications, 2009.
